column1: Ascariasis is an infection with the parasitic roundworm Ascaris lumbricoides.
Ascariasis is the most common intestinal worm infectionworm infection.
People who live in places where human feces (stool) are used as fertilizer are also at risk for this disease.
They travel up through the large airways of the lungs, and are swallowed back into the stomach and small intestine.
Once the larvae are back in the small intestine, they mature into adult roundworms.
Ascariasis occurs in people of all ages, though children are affected more severely than adults.
